elements.2211.03062_6d85c36a484779e5acd9bcc4e7353: Myocardial pathology segmentation (MyoPS) can be a prerequisite for the accurate diagnosis and treatment planning of myocardial infarction
elements.2211.03062_e191ca1c01d4a3cc6248948fea3e4: However, achieving this segmentation is challenging, mainly due to the inadequate and indistinct information from an image
elements.2211.03062_7a77e445cc814ed395570cead4f81: In this work, we develop an end-to-end deep neural network, referred to as MyoPS-Net, to flexibly combine five-sequence cardiac magnetic resonance (CMR) images for MyoPS
elements.2211.03062_2570b1b1952be91de7eaac7ceee4e: To extract precise and adequate information, we design an effective yet flexible architecture to extract and fuse cross-modal features
elements.2211.03062_63be768c57b50febd2b4925eef598: This architecture can tackle different numbers of CMR images and complex combinations of modalities, with output branches targeting specific pathologies
elements.2211.03062_229114c871312ad62d34ed20c1580: To impose anatomical knowledge on the segmentation results, we first propose a module to regularize myocardium consistency and localize the pathologies, and then introduce an inclusiveness loss to utilize relations between myocardial scars and edema
elements.2211.03062_884db4ce31a2ab008b5e5386e6dae: We evaluated the proposed MyoPS-Net on two datasets,
elements.2211.03062_1681212a91720bcf8916f6c24966c: a private one consisting of 50 paired multi-sequence CMR images and a public one from MICCAI2020 MyoPS Challenge
elements.2211.03062_537b5bde5296058fcb93c9f149bce: Experimental results showed that MyoPS-Net could achieve state-of-the-art performance in various scenarios
elements.2211.03062_e183c8c0ec3ff3e30b5d18caf4f3a: Note that in practical clinics, the subjects may not have full sequences, such as missing LGE CMR or mapping CMR scans
elements.2211.03062_c9e75df993431a0ed6809b6114dcb: We therefore conducted extensive experiments to investigate the performance of the proposed method in dealing with such complex combinations of different CMR sequences
elements.2211.03062_ab7d66125e9fdb9902659be385dd8: Results proved the superiority and generalizability of MyoPS-Net, and more importantly, indicated a practical clinical application.
elements.2211.03062_8c906464552018426817e73509edf: Multi-sequence CMR, Myocardial pathology segmentation, Missing modality, Practical clinics
elements.2211.03062_574606699763002813607cf21f8a4: Myocardial infarction (MI), a common cardiovascular disease, is one of the leading causes of death in the world
elements.2211.03062_8f429fd02c31a70a1973527792d68: Quantitative evaluation of myocardial scars and edema is in great demand for effective diagnosis and treatment of MI
elements.2211.03062_a4ae2b761d1c76cce130ef6d7ba0e: In real clinical scenarios, multi-sequence cardiac magnetic resonance (CMR) imaging is usually employed as an efficacious tool for MI evaluation
elements.2211.03062_c709b2d64ad8bea31c5d355dcac77: In this work, we propose to consider five clinically available CMR sequences, including balanced steady-state free precession (bSSFP) sequence, late gadolinium enhancement (LGE) sequence, T2-weighted sequence, T1 mapping sequence and T2* mapping sequence
elements.2211.03062_83496df4b1e73c3ec95a6adf22e2d: Examples of these sequences are presented in Fig.
elements.2211.03062_eae13b2591c74f12904095370697f: Specifically, bSSFP CMR can provide clear boundaries of the myocardium and left ventricle (LV) for scar and edema evaluation; LGE CMR reveals the scar regions with distinctive brightness compared to the healthy myocardium, while T2, T1 mapping and T2* mapping images provide pathological information without injection of contrast agents
elements.2211.03062_6bcd3fd8a68fdf081d0f72dae6ba3: To conduct quantitative analysis of multi-sequence CMR images, accurate and efficient segmentation of myocardial pathology regions becomes a necessity
elements.2211.03062_f2cf43652246d8b70224e17da413b: Because of the difficulty in manual delineation, which is time-consuming and sometimes subjective, automating this segmentation is highly demanded
elements.2211.03062_0f729bfd55514a9be78bbc37192ad: However, achieving such automatic segmentation is still arduous, mainly due to inferior image quality, blurry pathology boundaries, various pathology appearances and the difficulty in fusing multi-sequence information
elements.2211.03062_2570d9f94a8359d40a198c3e4341e: Limited studies have been reported on automatic myocardial scar and edema segmentation
elements.2211.03062_60f96fa8c5163946a13430d4f98e6: A large number of approaches on MyoPS solely focus on one type of pathologies,
elements.2211.03062_a3c78c7ad5783c8a1511503c20269: proposed threshold-based methods to perform scar segmentation, while
elements.2211.03062_c269d4913fb1c67f2a038ca51b853: developed similar method for edema segmentation
elements.2211.03062_f58a135fee0e2a92ab83c9bc602ad: Besides, given the difficulty in mining multi-sequence information, most of the reported algorithms barely employed a single sequence for MyoPS, especially LGE CMR which probably contains the most information
elements.2211.03062_0210b101ac5348d2740d4c7a6c8e7: , in spite of the drawback of injecting contrast agents
elements.2211.03062_0c06e4aa1fd760b476a1f7177d47b: proposed a 3D network for myocardial disease segmentation with LGE CMR images
elements.2211.03062_2a297b54cdfa5b3403e2f23251c9e: However, multi-sequence CMR images can offer supplementary pathology-related features for scar and edema segmentation
elements.2211.03062_e1c4758e05c2086fb193b9b2aafbe: Effectively extracting instructive features from multi-sequence CMR images becomes essential for MyoPS
elements.2211.03062_e3a78be8c6d101be7bce4a55b1467: Furthermore, to better localize the tiny pathologies, existing methods were usually designed in a two-stage manner
elements.2211.03062_3f2bbf72532174fa6cdbc651d7bc3: , namely first extracting the myocardium and then segmenting scars and edema on the extracted myocardium
elements.2211.03062_fa18f2ce410b87ca639039f9985fa: In this work, we propose an end-to-end deep learning framework for MyoPS combining multi-sequence CMR images, which can be abbreviated as MyoPS-Net
elements.2211.03062_3f7d8f9814e6e5123a84828167e28: The CMR images considered here include the end-diastolic (ED) phase of the cine bSSFP sequence, referred to as C0 image, and four other CMR sequences,
elements.2211.03062_99723484ff16d8126ef1e11714794: LGE, T2, T1 mapping and T2* mapping, at the same ED phase
elements.2211.03062_1a23e41c4f01d83fd7a8bb8bcb9a0: The former provides clear anatomical information, while the latter four offer critical information for the myocardial pathologies, namely scars and edema
elements.2211.03062_b702454930df369caf563c8fdb4d3: To deal with the complex information from multi-sequence images, we introduce a cross-modal feature fusion architecture to learn both inter- and intra-sequence pathological features
elements.2211.03062_97796e53d5ecaf4ef5375a6a6e996: To efficiently localize the pathology regions, we adopt a myocardium prior and consistency module to impose constraints on the myocardium
elements.2211.03062_cd7bb9de95547152bb43c745d039a: Finally, considering the spatial relations between the pathologies,
elements.2211.03062_33fa9c1dbdc5b2cd2253949c386c0: scars lying inside edema, we further develop an inclusiveness loss, as a regularization term, to incorporate this prior knowledge into the process of feature learning and segmentation inference
elements.2211.03062_386d92d86eeb85e75890843890009: The remaining paper is organized as follows: Section
elements.2211.03062_d203ca9666704752dc63fc3b28375: The detailed structure of MyoPS-Net is described in Section
elements.2211.03062_4a8d7448ef7202c82a85f6a0ad1d8: illustrates the experiments and results and Section
elements.2211.03062_024de845b61e77213c75531ed466b: For myocardial pathology segmentation, there exists a series of conventional algorithms
elements.2211.03062_330a1ed86c878ba3dceb06027459f: utilized threshold methods for scar segmentation based on the intensity differences between healthy and diseased myocardium.
elements.2211.03062_dc19dc2df4ffd97d8482237c9e15c: combined the threshold segmentation with a morphological filtering algorithm for edema segmentation
elements.2211.03062_fd0040964b176e1a0074a97292f6e: Considering the drawbacks of thresholding methods,
elements.2211.03062_267809db8f707901ac58a00469f36: formulated a continuous max-flow optimization problem for edema segmentation
elements.2211.03062_5b5ec79ead23daf80afad1a6b7e7c: Moreover, graph-cuts were also employed for pathology segmentation
elements.2211.03062_7b03c033fe6e6df993d85348f92fa: Recently, deep learning (DL)-based algorithms have presented satisfying performance in the field of medical image segmentation
elements.2211.03062_5a5bb627a87a8467ffe230d0723d2: have the widest applications in the field of image segmentation
elements.2211.03062_a487ff942b8ecbe877cadedcff88d: proposed a LearnGC framework for scar quantification from LGE CMR images by combining CNNs and graph-cuts.
elements.2211.03062_8f64f0018ee018045504e117d07f9: introduced fully convolutional networks to quantitatively evaluate myocardial scars
elements.2211.03062_63b4671937fec3f0d7076c819a3b2: Specially, with the emergence of U-Net
elements.2211.03062_49c20dd31e5546aac8da9cde423d3: , an extremely huge proportion of medical image segmentation frameworks are proposed on the basis of U-Net
elements.2211.03062_ef2e9ad96a07d09e87311470bcad2: proposed a multi-branch U-Net to perform multi-task learning of joint left atrial segmentation and scar quantification on LGE CMR images.
elements.2211.03062_0ba8c587dbcc0e6461ce12f85b99d: performed automatic scar segmentation with a cascaded multi-planar U-Net
elements.2211.03062_8e026f3398f1ae72f3327ea5bf769: To the best of our knowledge, most of the work merely concentrated on either scar or edema segmentation and usually employed a single CMR sequence
elements.2211.03062_189e67550ed1c5ec6ac1f625f248d: With the growth of the modeling ability of deep learning frameworks, studies have recently focused on combining multi-sequence information for MyoPS to leverage abundant pathology-related features provided by multi-sequence CMR images
elements.2211.03062_f7cf5c3b29a96c793981fd3e00594: A two-stage segmentation strategy has been proposed to segment scars and edema simultaneously
elements.2211.03062_6deef392afc20a82c730b5c5f7605: employed one shared encoder to collect features from multi-sequence CMR images.
elements.2211.03062_4137e03436514c9db384d444c86ff: proposed a fully automatic pathology segmentation framework consisting of an anatomical structure segmentation network and a pathological region segmentation network.
elements.2211.03062_1dfb7ac7762504ef9abdb485d5576: introduced a multi-layer fusion to merge features from multi-sequence CMR images
elements.2211.03062_b2a55a02f9aaf2ab94f0ca3bc9a3a: combinedly utilized deep supervision and deep reinforcement learning for MyoPS
elements.2211.03062_f8d715d6e6e63767334008e554a12: Besides, considering the fuzzy boundaries and the class-imbalance problem of scars and edema,
elements.2211.03062_dcb87f2d1791d89cfb4a6e48903fb: proposed a boundary loss to perform MyoPS based on an efficient net
elements.2211.03062_92268b880ae01443108d3e3f99b66: Deep learning based multi-modality medical image segmentation
elements.2211.03062_ce6574a4858c67183217dc992a02e: Multi-modality is a typical characteristic in the field of medical image analysis
elements.2211.03062_ab21f902445527864db83d839df33: As multi-modality images could usually provide much more information than single modality ones, studying multi-modality images has thus become a hot spot
elements.2211.03062_27764ed5dfae9275c7ad301f58e1e: Recently, some challenges were held for multi-modality medical image segmentation, such as BraTS Challenge
elements.2211.03062_038a2599b47494be6cd60e8f64723: These challenges further arouse the research interest towards fusing multi-modality information
elements.2211.03062_23761c713e8a689e714aad067051f: Specifically, the fusion strategy of network architectures can be divided into three categories, namely input-level fusion, layer-level fusion and decision-level fusion
elements.2211.03062_f4e41c08ca6f6d53069f0251bab10: The proposed MyoPS-Net introduces a fusion strategy from the layer level
elements.2211.03062_f896fdba89f53407d63171d02f996: As for the input-level fusion strategy, medical images from multi-modality are directly concatenated to generate the multi-channel inputs of the network
elements.2211.03062_0af4a202d50fc5fb4bb3c8d67bc33: This strategy obviously treats multi-modality images equally and thus concentrates on the formulation of the network architecture
elements.2211.03062_588a4a3792a780958a709618b61fe: employed a residual U-Net and generative adversarial networks to perform brain tumor segmentation simply by fusing multi-modality images as multi-channel inputs
elements.2211.03062_614aaed9584d92dd8a545f5e3162a: When it comes to the layer-level fusion method, each modality image is individually transferred into the network to extract features
elements.2211.03062_1efe7cf6719d7200b430155c12dc3: Different from input-level strategy, layer-level fusion focuses on modifying the network architectures
elements.2211.03062_312e430b1ab81faceac383b47a27b: The multi-modality features are fused inside the layer of the networks and are then synthesized into a unified feature representation for the final segmentation.
elements.2211.03062_93e98d82849acb9a489f656e097ca: proposed a convolution neural framework based on DenseNets with dense connections between multi-modality features.
elements.2211.03062_dd042bcd43ad78aee0d19ace0e683: introduced a dual-path strategy to fuse features from multi-sequence CMR images for MyoPS.
elements.2211.03062_30eeb536c7f0468912971ab4179c6: combined layer-level fusion with adversarial learning for liver tumor segmentation
elements.2211.03062_921a8eea27f40856d2f8ed22966e2: Further, some disentanglement-based methods were recently introduced for multi-modality segmentation
elements.2211.03062_286362fa6ab295744e2f36cb5a1af: In the decision-level strategy, similar to the above layer-level one, multi-modality images are trained with independent networks to generate the corresponding features
elements.2211.03062_a412fa40e8e57c4fd0d341cccd175: However, there exist none of feature transmissions between different modalities
elements.2211.03062_1b03c4df6a77b721bf6ba0f7d7520: The multi-modality information is fused at the lower layer of the encoders and these mixed features will be employed to acquire the segmentation results
elements.2211.03062_c88d0726d10389525344e3776516f: provides an overview of the proposed MyoPS-Net that can combine different CMR images, such as C0, LGE, T2, T1 mapping and T2* mapping CMR images for MyoPS
elements.2211.03062_53fe925bbd3d38885bfddd0125520: MyoPS-Net is an end-to-end architecture consisting of a cross-modal feature fusion module (Section
elements.2211.03062_e0124ae12f01f6ccb4180b58802f1: ), two assisting modules for imposing myocardium prior and consistency (Section
elements.2211.03062_30d6a6c03fdda920b0475e8e665e2: Besides, the proposed MyoPS-Net can be applied to four different scenarios in practical clinics (Section
elements.2211.03062_ee5da2a90cdaef173f131eb51284d: Cross-modal feature fusion for multi-sequence CMR
elements.2211.03062_bd3043243380402482d55ea312179: Each of the multi-sequence CMR images has a specific influence on the final results of MyoPS
elements.2211.03062_7a065296b38812bbd176365cc4a9c: For example, LGE CMR is promising in discriminating myocardial scars, but it also provides complementary information for edema segmentation
elements.2211.03062_7ad0f5cb7670b5a2fec2b2f63a4df: Therefore, it is crucial to fuse multi-sequence features to excavate hidden inter-sequence relations
elements.2211.03062_04eee1a4413912f5b33a438434482: We propose a cross-modal feature fusion (CMFF) module to fuse multi-sequence information
elements.2211.03062_f39cdd6f932c4e50c2cd2d72f95ea: CMFF is the main architecture of MyoPS-Net, as Fig.
elements.2211.03062_19a6f8c4116f0a27fcf122422af67: shows, and is designed to effectively extract the features contained in the CMR images (via CMR encoders), and fuse them for pathology segmentation (via scar/ edema decoders)
elements.2211.03062_35f94b37cc9079b591a56264d02e0: For feature fusion, CMFF adopts two operations, namely max operation and skip connection
elements.2211.03062_4b78aaca46338de8abba835dd0a26: illustrates the detail of network architecture
elements.2211.03062_7851067219972c69b562351387321: be the multi-scale features of CMR encoders, where
elements.2211.03062_5e1acaa186b7bdf41cde7caa4d90e: denotes the index of CMR sequences except C0, and
elements.2211.03062_7979896a44edf3ec77821c17a4932: means the index of layers of encoders
elements.2211.03062_69c3ec0e7db052185c869f6ac0839: Therefore, a pixel-wise max operation is performed on these features as follows,
elements.2211.03062_f148a579b50ca37aa363eb4149572: means the fused features from all other
elements.2211.03062_1ed70afcf72430a8a9fa37d91bc7d: as the sets of scar decoders and edema decoders, respectively
elements.2211.03062_407eb80678563a78ce227e8ef725f: When the fused features are obtained, we then introduce connections from
elements.2211.03062_8e8acf1944b5cf89578b43fb0bee6: to the corresponding layers of pathology (scar or edema) decoder
elements.2211.03062_231acad5a014d4abb8f37277a8888: With this module, the pathology segmentation networks can learn cross-modal information through multi-scale features from all other sequences
elements.2211.03062_272dfca67902622664228cdcc7d68: In our application, we have four CMR sequences to perform pathology segmentation,
elements.2211.03062_7e53b1e945ee23f69fa84252894db: LGE, T2, T1 mapping and T2* mapping CMR
elements.2211.03062_80dd67ce287f238e6429e81f7bcab: We adopt three encoders for these four CMR sequences,
elements.2211.03062_e2940bea2a80cee8d542fad04800e: one for LGE, another for T2 and a third for mappings (T1 mapping and T2* mapping), to extract pathological features
elements.2211.03062_8305b1b69b4ae416992d2a31bb965: For decoders, note that for each CMR sequence above, one can either use two decoders, respectively for scars and edema, to perform pathology segmentation, or use just one to more effectively segment one type of pathology
elements.2211.03062_6efba753c07c851106bfaae790eea: For example, in this work we propose to couple a scar decoder to LGE CMR, an edema decoder to T2 CMR, and a scar decoder to mapping CMR according to the clinical knowledge and experimental results from Section
elements.2211.03062_0aff06c7bccefdf718b3a5381462c: Constraint for myocardium prior and consistency
elements.2211.03062_3e4d2242a93534f3032d7b919f986: Since scars and edema lie in the myocardium, it is straightforward to consider the myocardium as a prior
elements.2211.03062_5a12429f67bdb4be4d06574b0bbe0: Existing methods usually segment the myocardium via a separated network and then employ the cropped ROIs for further MyoPS
elements.2211.03062_c34ebc039c7df2328daf4acd0512c: This requires the myocardial segmentation tool to be reliable, since it is the prerequisite for following MyoPS
elements.2211.03062_23fca316be4a96dfb53d13e22447e: Here, we instead propose to embed a myocardium prior and consistency (MPC) module in the MyoPS-Net to localize the pathologies
elements.2211.03062_02d9436fc5a7d4ab006c2a4ae2bf0: Denote the five sequences of CMR images, namely C0, LGE, T2, T1 mapping and T2* mapping CMR, as
elements.2211.03062_576628cb9e2d81362dfb92e73256c: The input of the MPC module, as shown in Fig.
elements.2211.03062_2449c915f16da484b302a12a784f6: , is obtained by directly concatenating these five-sequence images, which can be explicitly expressed as
elements.2211.03062_2f9cad8bc680bd74035cfe69cc279: Therefore, the MPC module which employs U-Net
elements.2211.03062_9ba5f1fdb17fb175fb0145f53b9bd: as the backbone can merge distinct features of cardiac structure from the five images and achieve the probability map containing the myocardium (Myo) and left ventricle (LV) information, which is represented as
elements.2211.03062_6f86cf596d3559e5d8357c4a0edcc: One can easily concatenate these features with the raw images
elements.2211.03062_c46683834c3cab6a8fb005997d9e2: as inputs of pathology networks, which then benefit from the myocardium prior for localizing and segmenting pathologies within the myocardium
elements.2211.03062_4475f6636739e9f4a47f9dc956175: Therefore, we propose a consistency loss on the MPC module, to regularize the invariability of the myocardium
elements.2211.03062_717c2c5c214f38439160261887860: Specifically, we reformulated the probability maps into two parts,
elements.2211.03062_da853580ee25afaf3f870ac3067d6: illustrated the probability of being identified as the myocardium, while
elements.2211.03062_426440680bde60f5c0e4c0e597b09: indicates the probability of all other structures except the myocardium
elements.2211.03062_fe13a5c9f632393ad11e108d62ca1: The reformulated probability maps are defined as follows,
elements.2211.03062_182f7a093187408727176e7a1c69a: represent the modified and original probability maps of the MPC module, respectively.
elements.2211.03062_473f12b4a2b1577e4932017179bcb: stand for the probability maps where
elements.2211.03062_4bbe9a2137a5377a318b7f2b58175: The consistency loss is then given by,
elements.2211.03062_bba94edd3580ea1ab3fe2d2f154d9: is the cosine similarity loss and
elements.2211.03062_04f0cf8472bf8cac6e60e65ce2ad5: To embed this prior knowledge, we introduce a pathology inclusiveness (PI) loss in the MyoPS-Net which can be applied to both labeled and unlabeled data.

elements.2211.03062_9d426501f072f15bd8c17a0eb2077: With this loss, the pathology networks can effectively perceive the spatial relationship between scars and edema for both labeled and unlabeled data

elements.2211.03062_403219e4aaa118fcbf395574a4834: Application of MyoPS-Net in practical clinics
elements.2211.03062_383987dcafc2e9754a52a935ee8f0: Ideally, all the five CMR sequences are available for accurate MyoPS, but in practical scenarios some sequences may be missing
elements.2211.03062_87de98955fb58c3a0526559063629: Specifically, mapping CMR images are often excluded from a standard protocol, due to the limited scanning time
elements.2211.03062_3102192b79b2d901540c639b4cb50: Also, due to the injection of contrast agents, many subjects do not take LGE CMR, for example for healthy individuals undergoing a physical examination or for patients with a kidney condition not suitable for gadolinium contrast agents
elements.2211.03062_5f803ee28ee3eb301b2fb8779afe1: Therefore, there are four scenarios for practical usage of the proposed MyoPS-Net, as follows.
elements.2211.03062_a6a6d61ba3f0171f13fae61f787f8: : A model trained on full five-sequence CMR and tested solely on five sequence CMR images for MyoPS, which is also referred to as MyoPS-Net-F. Under this setting, the decoder set
elements.2211.03062_5ced8e888602b47435e2b234b8739: contains two scar decoders respectively for LGE and mapping CMR, and the decoder set
elements.2211.03062_7d5438fecc8dbe2ed02902ef64d98: contains an edema decoder for T2 CMR.
elements.2211.03062_b4e1790b307056fb5862cf976d4b1: : A model trained on three-sequence CMR,
elements.2211.03062_35d8591e63d277a8ed92825dff7ad: bSSFP C0, LGE and T2 CMR, and tested solely on data of such three-sequence CMR images
elements.2211.03062_f9a009290c975b9194c0db0ecb616: contains only one scar decoder for LGE CMR, and the decoder set
elements.2211.03062_96f9ea6116394b8d22a1f7d2392c6: has the same setting as the first scenario.
elements.2211.03062_e21de9b57570cc1319c4211a6724f: : A model trained on four-sequence CMR,
elements.2211.03062_a68812eb118121712a80b6a1d5d37: bSSFP C0, T2, T1 mapping and T2* mapping CMR, and tested solely on data of such four-sequence CMR images

elements.2211.03062_d826026575f512d06800639bb4eb1: The ground truth segmentation of scars and edema was constructed from manual annotations by one cardiologist

elements.2211.03062_d221571f43f7f6223b91b602e80dd: Besides, we invited another cardiologist to delineate the same ten cases for the inter-observer variations, which were 0.704
elements.2211.03062_475266e363eb45a914ec69aedca47: 0.045 for myocardial scar and edema, respectively

elements.2211.03062_1a76959011460eefc7e2b1e0ecd09: We employ five evaluation metrics in the experiments,
elements.2211.03062_e141a9c85656a2a34da004d285fb4: Dice score, Hausdorff distance (HD), Accuracy (ACC), Sensitivity (SEN) and Specificity (SPE).
elements.2211.03062_1e07f77471b53817f6f9b2abed927: are the number of pixels of the true and false positives, which represent the myocardial pathologies
elements.2211.03062_d6aeb9b6601c64cf87225caa136e9: refer to the true and false negatives, respectively
elements.2211.03062_8610f582dd2651e196b12337e58e2: ACC evaluates the overall pixel-wise accuracy of the segmentation results
elements.2211.03062_01a12a16d611b7ce23bb4b853018d: SEN and SPE measure the ability of models to identify positive and negative pixels, respectively

elements.2211.03062_b1dfba4fadfebbd5be836cad9c591: These models employed 25 cases from each CMR sequence for training and were tested on 20 cases from the same CMR sequence
elements.2211.03062_1fbd1918da2fe5663c57bbb3f5c3c: As for LGE CMR, both networks achieved evidently better Dice scores on scar segmentation than the other two sequences
elements.2211.03062_69b74b37db6702535767bb3fe4600: Besides, the Dice scores of edema on LGE CMR were also good, thanks to the accurate scar segmentation which accounts for a major proportion of the edema areas
elements.2211.03062_5a21df3ae6ae32d00e4ba39d5d326: For T2 CMR, its edema segmentation was reliable by both two models, but the scar segmentation had a great drop in Dice scores
elements.2211.03062_b26f6a78ccd776ed5dc4b4969a724: This is reasonable as T2 CMR usually provides edema information while LGE CMR mainly offers scar-related information
elements.2211.03062_adaed476e0b72cdcc7504e68a7a20: For mapping CMR, the segmentation of either two types of pathologies was not accurate enough, thus more information from other sequences would be needed for reliable MyoPS.
elements.2211.03062_06a5f95c829f32dec6863a9704a58: Ablation study on the model architecture
elements.2211.03062_f8b28df115ea2042db2e03f15a434: To evaluate the effectiveness of the model architecture, we conducted experiments on four different settings of pathology decoders in the proposed cross-modal feature fusion architecture
elements.2211.03062_e4a972193d43df604e0f8cd2c9462: illustrates the quantitative evaluation results of these four frameworks along with the proposed MyoPS-Net
elements.2211.03062_3324ba833d1293c55e31e683dcf49: 1 employs two decoders (a scar decoder and an edema decoder) for all CMRs to perform MyoPS
elements.2211.03062_0caf66caf66ecdf387c181efd4d66: Specifically, the fused features from the four CMR sequences except C0 were fed into the scar decoder and the edema decoder for pathology segmentation via a pixel-wise max operation
elements.2211.03062_d08b3dcb437d35a056cc722fe6c6d: 1 is presented in the Supplementary Material
elements.2211.03062_73ebaee824bcd3cf1c11652edf758: 2 indicates the basic situation of six decoders for three CMRs with a scar decoder and an edema decoder for each
elements.2211.03062_86bd61f1f968f7ab2ffaacdfb5bbb: 5 have the same setting on LGE and T2 CMR as the proposed MyoPS-Net, namely a scar decoder for LGE CMR and an edema decoder for T2 CMR
elements.2211.03062_fe24e2c2678ebc11a60e28cc2bc3f: 3 holds two decoders (a scar decoder and an edema decoder) for mapping CMR, model
elements.2211.03062_84eea3477255a4d657d85e6a49222: 4 has only an edema decoder, while
elements.2211.03062_11a43e57b20131c6ef040eb42cc60: 5 (the proposed MyoPS-Net) is designed with a scar decoder for mapping CMR
elements.2211.03062_0b46e546b358f17af2f8ea6e4318d: , with one specific pathology decoder, model
elements.2211.03062_79063a2797d4db719f87782854d99: Therefore, in the following studies, we adopted this setting of model
elements.2211.03062_74227f43fff51933bc133f62be15a: Ablation study on the proposed modules
elements.2211.03062_8efcc0590b05b7f7dde5f80ee9c51: This study investigates the effectiveness of each separate module in the proposed MyoPS-Net
elements.2211.03062_5b1bf8f13be19d0d3061689b6a36f: presents the quantitative evaluation results of models with different modules and Fig.
elements.2211.03062_273b9d396d408b141c39df8db5249: visualizes the segmentation results of three cases based on
elements.2211.03062_81c886cd7252f4105bc9bf45a855b: a good case, a median case and a poor case
elements.2211.03062_ebb68b3d9ae032829b66d83bcae0b: The baseline was only with basic U-Nets, and obtained a poor performance for pathology segmentation
elements.2211.03062_10f13624901d580e067b1b33c51f1: For the CMFF module, we tried two different strategies,
elements.2211.03062_95e5e68b326c273ad6cc972da40db: max operation and mean operation, to fuse multi-sequence features
elements.2211.03062_d034892bc10ad8119eb693c26c446: However, the average Dice scores of employing the mean operation were 0.603
elements.2211.03062_38d31d5a55dc6c5949344cafa3d9a: 0.114 for myocardial scars and edema, respectively
elements.2211.03062_cb4cd71a51682855c8edab5a4c7fe: Based on the above results, we utilized the max operation in our model
elements.2211.03062_8f26fceaa16dcd23e15fd0374b00c: Then, with the CMFF module, the segmentation performance of the model was boosted, compared to the baseline with evidently and significantly better pathology segmentation
elements.2211.03062_9f51c2e775168c9210ecaa0f09986: This verifies the importance of cross-modal feature fusion architecture, which utilizes the complementary information from the multi-sequence CMR for MyoPS
elements.2211.03062_278180f1e42f34b5c49e1fe068970: The model only with the MPC module also achieved significantly better Dice scores than the baseline for both scar and edema segmentation
elements.2211.03062_dd8d5fe6e4edf2f0ae2725232dc26: To further demonstrate the effectiveness of the MPC module, we performed a correlation analysis between the Dice scores of the myocardium segmentation and the Dice scores of the MyoPS
elements.2211.03062_1c6f532c5586ba68ae2a4aad3f69a: , there existed approximate positive linear correlations between the myocardium and the pathologies, verifying that the MPC module assisted the framework in localizing and then segmenting the pathologies
elements.2211.03062_781c7a354b8b2b1067fd0e716c592: , the segmentation results of both the model with CMFF and the model with MPC had smoother and more accurate boundaries, compared to the baseline
elements.2211.03062_0796de6192fb0504a3f5c752cf440: When combining the CMFF and MPC modules, the model obtained further improved accuracies
elements.2211.03062_fc497a7bdeef9e289206ad8522def: Besides, the shape of segmentation results was further optimized to be close to the ground truth
elements.2211.03062_b94af162f2fd87653abe5188841c9: Finally, integrating the proposed three modules, we had the proposed MyoPS-Net, which achieved the best Dice scores and HDs for MyoPS
elements.2211.03062_7c07a8bec8e35141e82355f33acc3: These segmentation results illustrate that MyoPS-Net can employ the pathology inclusiveness to further improve the MyoPS performance.
elements.2211.03062_9f32f849be381da3d67b5266f44bd: This study evaluates the application of MyoPS-Net in a semi-supervised situation
elements.2211.03062_7b5f8ec870d43fb6ae1108078f188: illustrates the quantitative evaluation results of different models employing different numbers of labeled and unlabeled data
elements.2211.03062_d186b111df4e5d3b62490fee8191a: Among these models, we experimented with three semi-supervised situations, which employ a total of 25 cases for training, with the number of labeled data decreasing from 20 to 10 in a step of 5
elements.2211.03062_33a762f9d05b8672928064ef04061: For comparison, we additionally conducted four experiments in a fully supervised situation, with the number of labeled data ranging from 25 to 10 in the same step
elements.2211.03062_917d44b8fbcee282b1a7430582455: The model with 25 labeled data achieved the best segmentation performance
elements.2211.03062_014b522099f590eea8fcb7d1cc656: With the proportion of unlabeled data increasing, the segmentation performance of the semi-supervised models gradually dropped
elements.2211.03062_1bf5e904fff0c32f307910730c45f: Nevertheless, the three semi-supervised models achieved comparable scar segmentation results towards the model with 25 labeled data
elements.2211.03062_f23d6af941320551caf9f286be664: The segmentation performance of edema evidently decreased when more than 10 unlabeled cases were utilized, which illustrated that edema segmentation was much more sensitive to the reduction of supervision than scar segmentation
elements.2211.03062_2b69d9ac7d39be1146c42707387dc: Besides, these semi-supervised models outperformed the corresponding fully supervised models with the additional unlabeled data
elements.2211.03062_0bf07cdb49c0f262b49fdb243c796: For example, the semi-supervised model with 20 labeled data and 5 unlabeled data achieved better scar and edema segmentation than the fully supervised model only with 20 labeled data, as well as the other two situations
elements.2211.03062_88fb3e307a334e3e95cf56be70436: These results demonstrated that the proposed MyoPS-Net can employ complementary pathological information from multi-sequence CMR images for effective semi-supervised MyoPS.

elements.2211.03062_9c0fc9fdbf2de0cea36e1769dd473: illustrated the quantitative evaluation results of the proposed MyoPS-Net-mix
elements.2211.03062_f4f1423f2d7bf92194e297dcee709: The segmentation results of the proposed MyoPS-Net-mix on the scenarios of five-sequence CMR and three-sequence CMR without LGE were evidently better than the corresponding separate models
elements.2211.03062_cb93d06bd95a3e0a23e5df3829e7d: Besides, MyoPS-Net-mix achieved a similar segmentation performance on the scenario of four-sequence CMR without mappings compared to the separate model

elements.2211.03062_111b384324cc9b6500a601beff71b: To evaluate the segmentation performance of the proposed methods, we conducted three experiments respectively for the proposed MyoPS-Net, MyoPS-Net-L and MyoPS-Net-M mentioned in Section
elements.2211.03062_4d6a299b1e7e3201ced70de3a5fff: presented the quantitative evaluation results of these three models
elements.2211.03062_6edb57b2f5e8060f54fa8968d6167: (a) visualized the segmentation results of three typical cases in terms of
elements.2211.03062_b285e5eb7bc2e481b3bf19806f26a: of the average Dice scores, namely a good case, a median case and a poor case, and Fig.
elements.2211.03062_b0ff2e101b640ffe50961644eefc2: (b) illustrated the Dice scores of three models using box plots
elements.2211.03062_2ee9648e8596ee805ae7edac324cf: All of these three models achieved promising MyoPS results on the private dataset
elements.2211.03062_d8f9775b3c74eff93048b857ca76c: For MyoPS-Net, which obtained the best Dice scores and HDs, the segmentation performance had smoother and more accurate results than the other two models, which demonstrated that MyoPS-Net could excavate instructive features from five-sequence CMR images for a better MyoPS performance. (R2-Comment2.2) Besides, one can see that the proposed MyoPS-Net can obtain comparable results toward the intra- and inter-observer variations described in Section
elements.2211.03062_2f103660812ffe23c395099098360: MyoPS-Net-L achieved competitive performance without employing mapping CMR
elements.2211.03062_2ef85cd8502c319aa4ef3b1ff53dc: However, the segmentation results of MyoPS-Net-L showed a decrease compared to MyoPS-Net, which illustrated that mapping CMR provides complementary pathological features for MyoPS
elements.2211.03062_a96186115508ccc63054b185d4504: Without the assistance of LGE CMR, MyoPS-Net-M achieved a relatively low but competitive performance, which revealed that this framework can effectively extract pathological information from T2 and mapping CMR to perform MyoPS
elements.2211.03062_9dd3b29e096c07309f35fb6e57672: To further demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed framework, an extensive experiment was conducted on the public dataset from the MICCAI2020 MyoPS challenge
elements.2211.03062_edcc77f8a0d54c9b8931bdc22ba89: presented the average Dice scores of the proposed framework compared to outstanding algorithms from the MyoPS Challenge
elements.2211.03062_66b5fbf85aa60890e9438a34b82f6: performed MyoPS via a two-stage strategy, while EfficientSeg
elements.2211.03062_45f01e896e68d55d2851eff2c2aaf: Considering the scenario of this challenge, namely three-sequence CMR without mapping CMR, we employed MyoPS-Net-L to conduct an experiment with the same training and test sets as the public dataset
elements.2211.03062_f3c79d5a643f9d7368f646b90af96: Besides, ensemble learning methods have been considered to achieve superior prediction performance
elements.2211.03062_76c61ddc54cffdee1d996379194a3: We then employed the bagging strategy, one of the most popular ensemble learning methods, to reduce uncertainty and increase the generalization abilities of our model
elements.2211.03062_01d3d1fa2fe3616bf15d388c44737: We trained multiple base models by modifying the initial weights
elements.2211.03062_bca5d72073cfc38ffe2669fcfc6a5: The final prediction was then achieved by pixel-wise majority voting on each corresponding prediction of these base models
elements.2211.03062_b64f51253c344c4c69a259f263a4b: The experimental results proved that the proposed MyoPS-Net-L achieved comparable MyoPS performance toward the state-of-the-art results.
elements.2211.03062_6e1100b133ef32abdad04b33aeb95: In this work, we have proposed an end-to-end unified framework for MyoPS combining multi-sequence CMR images
elements.2211.03062_77a4c1e70ffae92df401e770c04fe: Three major methodological contributions have been introduced
elements.2211.03062_d5bc0f37f34140e73b4611e2d885e: Firstly, an effective cross-modal feature fusion architecture is proposed to extract instructive features from multi-sequence CMR images
elements.2211.03062_aee5242595928a194c9cc7cee6fcf: Secondly, we propose a myocardium prior and consistency module to efficiently localize the desired pathologies
elements.2211.03062_f49a5121bbf37ba07fc9a9bf6bc84: Besides, an inclusiveness loss is introduced to impose constraints on pathology inclusiveness, which illustrates that scars are the subset of edema
elements.2211.03062_0a2beb9f5c8ccf865643c9ec9bfe2: Experimental results proved the effectiveness of the proposed framework and demonstrated that this framework can be applied to four different scenarios in practical clinics
elements.2211.03062_984669b52700034772af3c3505154: Specially, the proposed framework chiefly concentrates on studying flexible combinations of multi-sequence CMR images for MyoPS
elements.2211.03062_15db3e3657924f041acf3ead7ea0a: Ideally, employed full five-sequence CMR images will achieve the best scar and edema segmentation performance
elements.2211.03062_c88d67101d76b10c7fecf606a5e18: For patients who are suitable for gadolinium contrast agents, taking LGE CMR is a guarantee for preciser diagnosis and further treatment of myocardial infarction
elements.2211.03062_6ed04270e309987b2fba85341fc56: For those reluctant to inject contrast agents,
elements.2211.03062_541d1a3f4555a978e3accba21a671: , healthy individuals undergoing a physical examination, mapping CMR can be an acceptable substitute for effective diagnosis of myocardial infarction
elements.2211.03062_6b5171b4c10b81e6f263611348b1c: In the above three conditions, we considered that either LGE CMR or mapping CMR is missing
elements.2211.03062_60667466086da6cb3fd6ff5405ac5: Certainly, the proposed framework can also be applied to more complex conditions where more CMR sequences are missing
elements.2211.03062_bb9091f2a28d87892a7c03fd9e64a: For example, we conducted an experiment only with bSSFP C0 and LGE CMR images, and the average Dice scores were 0.583
elements.2211.03062_729f50eead0a4bc367d16c959688f: 0.125 for myocardial scars and edema, respectively
elements.2211.03062_1aa39455c7b9bd2952233014d7ee0: , this model achieved comparative performance on scar segmentation, but an evidently lower Dice score on edema segmentation because of lacking T2 CMR images
elements.2211.03062_4ebaf67acfa30d9f253325265b5e8: However, segmenting edema with the combination of bSSFP C0 and LGE CMR images could be meaningless and misleading in clinical practice
elements.2211.03062_e44d0fea781deb6f73cec50b5c3f2: This is because from clinical view, such combination does not provide pathological information to edema and the major proportion of edema region, which are scars, can be segmented from LGE CMR
elements.2211.03062_b894ef38d115423215a701973b67f: Hence, the AI model may simply segment a marginally dilated region of the scars, to achieve high Dice scores, even though it cannot segment small isolated edema regions that do not contain scars
elements.2211.03062_7badaebbcbb1e04d384512bf4ee69: Therefore, we did not consider such combinations that lack clinical meaning or pathological sense
elements.2211.03062_60fec6a460c0defa92d516aafcdb4: Besides, the proposed framework can be applied to more than five CMR sequences
elements.2211.03062_1e3dbdf1b03151eedeb94572915be: When there are more CMR sequences available, we can first analyze the clinical characteristics of these sequences
elements.2211.03062_bafef485fe26229782d990e27bfed: If these sequence shares similarities with LGE CMR or T2 CMR, we can then employ these sequences to perform scar or edema segmentation correspondingly
elements.2211.03062_92e9ec138766c5cd257f3144745af: If these sequences resemble mapping CMR, we should perform ablation study like Section
elements.2211.03062_02d2945e466f852dc993ce8edf52b: to determine the most suitable architecture
elements.2211.03062_3c48587595f5742d1aeb9f18a408b: There also exists two main limitations in this work
elements.2211.03062_011c083193f93a809dce97f1c8106: Firstly, we mainly focus on achieving MyoPS based on pre-aligned multi-sequence images using the MvMM method
elements.2211.03062_4d17fca64bc97d10a1f67d46cf3a9: However, these images are commonly not registered in clinical practice
elements.2211.03062_28594d29d70988e55304c59024420: Therefore, a unified registration and segmentation framework of MS-CMR for MyoPS is valuable for clinical applications but still challenging due to cross-modality variances, and thus will be our future work
elements.2211.03062_acd2bc62d04f2e28e4dea271d1df2: Besides, one can see that C0, LGE and T2 CMR images can provide information for the myocardium, myocardial scars and edema, respectively
elements.2211.03062_2c5cfc516c81d139edeffcce11b67: Mapping CMR is expected to replace LGE CMR under certain conditions
elements.2211.03062_adb88da674b6b376c6b825b4efe73: , but the proposed framework can only extract limited information from these sequences due to its poor quality and blurred pathology areas which is the second limitation
elements.2211.03062_d25bb6719b5b4ec0e148ca3ed2422: In the future, we could employ cine CMR to facilitate the feature mining of mapping CMR
elements.2211.03062_d41401c759d5f7127bf0d90821a93: developed the usage of cine CMR images on MyoPS with generative adversarial networks.
elements.2211.03062_8f1028c4ca793624ab86909865721: proposed to synthesize an artificial CMR sequence which resembles LGE CMR via cine CMR images and T1 mapping CMR images
elements.2211.03062_a907713e011731f1bf343cf15f9da: Therefore, there still exists significant space to make explorations on mapping CMR images with the auxiliary of cine CMR images.
elements.2211.03062_61617de78e4a6609213fab6d23e74: This work was funded by the National Natural Science Foundation of China (grant No. 61971142, 62111530195 and 62011540404) and the development fund for Shanghai talents (No. 2020015).
